medical_history.chief_complaint: Human cytomegalovirus (HCMV) retinitis in patients with HIV infection unresponsive to highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 developed HCMV retinitis in September 1996 after multiple failed HAART regimens, with relapses observed in February 1997, August 1997, and July 1998. Patient 2 experienced his first episode of HCMV retinitis in June 1999 after 6 years of different treatments, showing a mixture of ganciclovir-resistant variants.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients had a history of HIV infection and underwent multiple HAART regimens with documented virologic failures and emergence of drug-resistant HIV strains.
medical_history.social_history: Both patients were injection drug users.
